Content:: COVID-19 vaccination in Equatorial Guinea is an ongoing immunisation campaign against severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2), the virus that causes coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), in response to the ongoing pandemic in the country. Equatorial Guinea began its vaccination program on 15 February 2021, initially with 100,000 doses of the Sinopharm BIBP vaccine donated by China.[1][2][3] On 11 February 2021, 100,000 donated doses of the Sinopharm BIBP vaccine arrived in Equatorial Guinea from China.[4] By the end of the month 9,265 doses had been administered.[citation needed] By the end of the month 55,799 doses had been administered. 8,389 persons had been fully vaccinated.[citation needed] By the end of the month 219,677 doses had been administered. 71,598 persons had been fully vaccinated.[citation needed] On 16 June 2021, Equatorial Guinea buys 500,000 doses of the Sinopharm BIBP vaccine.[5] By the end of the month 260,528 doses had been administered. 111,343 persons had been fully vaccinated.[citation needed] By the end of the month 301,413 doses had been administered. 122,500 persons had been fully vaccinated.[citation needed] By the end of the month 331,807 doses had been administered. 141,326 persons had been fully vaccinated.[citation needed] By the end of the month 397,083 doses had been administered. 167,635 persons had been fully vaccinated. By the end of the month 426,780 doses had been administered. 186,670 persons (32% of the target population) had been fully vaccinated. By the end of the month 443,135 doses had been administered. 196,616 persons (34% of the target population) had been fully vaccinated. By the end of the month 452,572 doses had been administered. 203,357 persons (35% of the target population) had been fully vaccinated. By the end of the month 463,549 doses had been administered. 206,023 persons had been fully vaccinated. By the end of the month 473,409 doses had been administered. 210,706 persons had been fully vaccinated. By the end of the month 479,991 doses had been administered. 214,486 persons had been fully vaccinated. Cumulative vaccinations in Equatorial Guinea[6]  This article about COVID-19 vaccines is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. This Cameroon-related article is a stub.
